import React from 'react'; function CO2Summary({ data }) { if (!data || data.length === 0) return null; const latest = data[data.length - 1]?.predicted_co2 || data[data.length - 1]?.emission; return (

üìä Understanding CO‚ÇÇ Emissions (MtCO‚ÇÇ)

MtCO‚ÇÇ stands for million metric tons of carbon dioxide. It's a standard unit to measure how much CO‚ÇÇ a country emits yearly.

üîé Current Insights:

  • {latest?.toFixed(2)} MtCO‚ÇÇ projected/emitted for the selected country.
  • Emissions above 100 MtCO‚ÇÇ typically indicate significant industrial or energy use.
  • Below 50 MtCO‚ÇÇ often reflects either smaller economies or proactive environmental policies.
üåç Global Impacts of High CO‚ÇÇ Levels:
Rising emissions contribute to:
  • üî• Global warming & heatwaves
  • üåä Sea level rise threatening coastal cities
  • üå™Ô∏è Extreme weather (storms, droughts, floods)
  • üåæ Crop stress and food insecurity
  • üê† Ocean acidification, killing marine life
  • ü´Å Public health risks due to pollution & heat
); } export default CO2Summary;
